rule.title: Healing Potion
rule.line: A healing potion is a vial of ruby-red liquid that imparts a tingling sensation as the drinker's wounds heal rapidly. When you drink a healing potion, you regain the listed number of Hit Points.

rule.title: Studded Leather Armor
rule.line: This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

variant.line: Magic wards deflect attacks. Increase the armor's item bonus to AC by 1. The armor can be etched with a property rune.
Resilient runes imbue armor with additional protective magic. This grants the wearer a +1 item bonus to saving throws.

rule.title: Steel Shield
rule.line: Though they come in a variety of shapes and sizes, the protection offered by wooden shields comes from the stoutness of their materials. While wooden shields are less expensive than steel shields, they break more easily.

variant.line: Reinforcing runes make a shield significantly more durable, allowing it to effectively block more powerful attacks.
A minor reinforcing rune increases the shield's Hardness by 3, Hit Points by 44, and its BT by 22 (maximum 8 Hardness, 64 HP, 32 BT).

rule.title: Magic Wand of Heal (rank 1)
rule.line: This baton is about a foot long and contains a 1st-rank heal that can be cast once per day. The golden end caps on this white wooden wand are adorned with ruby cabochons.

block.name: Activate
block.part: RequirementYou must have heal on your spell list
EffectYou Cast the Spell from the wand

OverchargeIf the spell has been cast from the wand for the day, you can cast it one more time by overcharging the wand at the risk of destroying it. After you Cast the Spell, make a DC 10 flat check. On a success, the wand is broken and can be repaired. On a failure, the wand is destroyed.
Activating a wand that has been overcharged for the day automatically destroys it, and no spell is cast.

rule.title: Magic Wand of Revealing Light
rule.line: This baton is about a foot long and contains a 2nd-rank revealing light that can be cast once per day. The brass wand is capped by a multi-faceted crystal.

block.name: Activate
block.part: RequirementYou must have revealing light on your spell list
EffectYou Cast the Spell from the wand

OverchargeIf the spell has been cast from the wand for the day, you can cast it one more time by overcharging the wand at the risk of destroying it. After you Cast the Spell, make a DC 10 flat check. On a success, the wand is broken and can be repaired. On a failure, the wand is destroyed.
Activating a wand that has been overcharged for the day automatically destroys it, and no spell is cast.

rule.title: Wand of Splintered Sorrows
rule.craft: Supply a casting of splinter volley of the appropriate level
rule.line: This wooden wand is roughly cut, as if it had been crudely chopped from a tree and left forgotten. When held, the wand imparts feelings of deep sorrow.

block.name: Activate
block.part: EffectYou cast splinter volley of the indicated rank. Each splinter contains some of the despair felt by cruelly harvested trees, causing any creature damaged by this spell to become stupefied 2 for a number of rounds equal to the spell's rank. On a critical success on the attack roll, the target also weeps, becoming slowed 1 for the same duration.

rule.title: Staff of Elemental Power
rule.line: This staff is tapered at the base and carved into a gem-studded twist at the top. While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus checks to identify elemental creatures.

block.name: Activate
block.part: EffectYou expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

variant.line: A greater staff of elemental power contains 3rd-rank and 4th-rank spells.

rule.title: Ring of Discretion
rule.line: A ring of discretion magically conceals any armor and sheathed weapons you're wearing by either turning them invisible or creating the illusion of ordinary clothes. The ring doesn't change your appearance beyond concealing weapons and armor.

As soon as you wield a weapon affected by the ring, the weapon becomes obvious to onlookers and is no longer affected until you sheathe the weapon for at least 1 minute. A creature can use the Seek action to examine you and disbelieve this illusion (DC 15), and it can attempt to do so without using an action each time it hits you with an attack.

rule.title: Charm of Resistance
rule.line: This charm, normally hung from the belt or worn around the neck, grants you resistance against one type of energy damage: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. Each charm is crafted to protect against a particular type of energy damage, and its design usually embodies the type of energy it protects the wearer from in some way. For instance, a charm of cold resistance could be carved in the shape of a yeti, whereas a charm of fire resistance would be made from volcanic glass.

variant.line: The charm grants resistance 5 to cold.

rule.title: Cloak of Illusions
rule.line: This cloak flows, covering and concealing the wearer's body. The cloak allows you to cast figment as an occult innate cantrip. Although naturally a dull gray, while invested the cloak picks up colors and patterns from its surroundings, granting an item bonus to Stealth checks.

block.name: Draw Hood
block.part: EffectYou draw the hood up and gain the effects the invisibility spell, with the spell's normal duration or until you pull the hood back down, whichever comes first.

rule.title: Figment
rule.line: You create a simple illusory sound or vision. A sound adds the auditory trait to the spell and the sound can't include intelligible words or elaborate music. A vision adds the visual trait and can be no larger than a 5-foot cube, and is clearly crude and undetailed if viewed from within 15 feet.

When you Cast or Sustain the Spell, you can attempt to Create a Diversion with the illusion, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to your Deception check. If the attempt fails against a creature, that creature disbelieves the figment.

rule.title: Invisibility
rule.line: Illusions bend light around the target, rendering it Invisible. This makes it Undetected to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it Hidden to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

rule.title: Guise of the Smirking Devil
rule.line: This ice-blue half-mask is adorned with a wicked silver grin that covers only the wearer's mouth. You gain an item bonus to Intimidation checks.

block.name: Hideous Wail
block.part: EffectThe mask emits a soul-chilling scream that deals 6d10 void damage to each living creature in a 20-foot emanation (DC 25 basic Fortitude save).

rule.title: Adventurer's Pack
rule.line: This is the starter kit for an adventurer, containing the essential items for exploration and survival.
The pack contains the following items: backpack (containing the other goods), bedroll, 10 pieces of chalk, flint and steel, 50 feet of rope, 2 weeks' rations, soap, 5 torches, and a waterskin.

variant.line: A backpack holds up to 4 Bulk of items, and the first 2 Bulk of these items don't count against your Bulk limits. If you're carrying or stowing the pack rather than wearing it, its Bulk is light instead of negligible and the Bulk reduction does not apply.

rule.title: Healer's Tools
rule.line: This kit of bandages, herbs, and suturing tools is necessary for Medicine checks to Administer First Aid, Treat Disease, Treat Poison, or Treat Wounds. If you wear your healer's tools, you can draw and replace them as part of the action that uses them.

variant.line: You gain a +1 item bonus to checks to Administer First Aid, Treat Disease, Treat Poison, or Treat Wounds.

rule.title: Repair Kit
rule.line: A repair kit allows you to perform simple repairs while traveling. It contains a portable anvil, tongs, woodworking tools, a whetstone, and oils for conditioning leather and wood. You can use a repair kit to Repair items using the Crafting skill. If you wear your repair kit, you can draw and replace them as part of the action to use them.
You can use a set of tools with 1 hand if you're wearing them, or 2 if you're holding them. You can wear up to 2 Bulk of Tools.
